meanings.definition: To package incorrectly or in a faulty manner.
meanings.sent1: The new employee tends to mispackage the products due to lack of training.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to mispackage the fragile items when wrapping them for shipping.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight when the robot mispackaged all the gifts for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to mispackage the truth, leaving everyone confused.
meanings.sent5: The chef's attempt to mispackage the ingredients resulted in a disastrous cake.

meanings.definition: An incorrectly or poorly packaged item.
meanings.sent1: The mispackage on the shelf had a torn wrapping and missing parts.
meanings.sent2: She received a mispackage in the mail, with the wrong items inside.
meanings.sent3: The mispackage looked like a puzzle with pieces sticking out from all sides.
meanings.sent4: The mispackage felt like a hidden treasure chest waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The mispackage stood out among the perfectly wrapped gifts, drawing attention.
